item.title: Microservices Are a Tax Your Startup Probably Can‚Äôt Afford
item.description: Why splitting your codebase too early can quietly destroy your team‚Äôs velocity ‚Äî and what to do instead. In a startup, your survival depends on how quickly you can iterate, ship features, and deliver value to end-users. This is where the foundational architecture of your startup plays a big role; additionally, things like your tech stack and choice of programming language directly affect your team‚Äôs velocity. The wrong architecture, especially premature microservices, can substantially hurt productivity and contribute to missed goals in delivering software.

item.title: Why Your Lambda Functions Need a Structural Makeover
item.description:
Hi, I'm James Eastham, In this video, I'll share how to structure your Lambda functions for modularity and longevity using Ports and Adapters architecture.
Avoid the pitfalls of monolithic code by separating business logic from infrastructure concerns.
Learn why a clean separation of concerns is vital for maintainable and adaptable code, regardless of whether you're using .NET, Node.js, Python, or Rust. By the end, you'll understand how to make your code more testable, scalable, and adaptable to changes in deployment environments.
00:00 Introduction and Initial Setup 00:56 Common Mistakes in Lambda Functions 01:17 Importance of Modularity and Clean Code 01:52 Introduction to Ports and Adapters 02:50 Driving and Driven Adapters Explained 03:56 Applying Ports and Adapters in Lambda 04:43 Practical Example: Recipe API 06:03 Refactoring for Better Code Design 09:12 Benefits of Clean Code and Modularity 11:14 Conclusion and Final Thoughts
item.author: (James Eastham)

item.title: My SO question was closed so I'm writing this post on CoreWCF
The Misunderstood Dependency Injection Lifetime in .NET
item.description:
Get 40% off everything on Dometrain: https://dometrain.com/courses/?ref=nick-chapsas&promo=youtube&coupon_code=BIRTHDAY2 Subscribe to my weekly newsletter: https://nickchapsas.com
Become a Patreon and get special perks: https://www.patreon.com/nickchapsas
Hello, everybody. I'm Nick, and in this video, I will talk about the Scoped Lifetime in .NET's dependency Injection framework and show you not only how it works but also how to control it and create your own scopes.
